intro: Solanum bimense, commonly known as the two-flowered nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other notable plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. Solanum bimense produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in pairs, giving it its common name. The fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, often containing several small seeds.
